intro: Malvastrum howellii, commonly known as Howell's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers and fuzzy, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Malvastrum howellii is adapted to full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy species in xeriscaped gardens.
